I hope this makes sense. Many thanks.

So far I can get the count (qty) of each box, but I do not know how to calculate the subtotal of each box since the quantity is in one model and the unit price in another model. Is it possible that someone can guide me through how to do this? Many thanks.

I need to be able to display each product by id. For example if I have 3 products with same id: count the quantity and just display it once. When the id is different display the other product. product 1 qty 2 price 10 subtotal 20 product 2 qty 1 price 20 subtotal 20 This is the current code.
@foreach (var group in Model.Products.GroupBy(p => p.ID)) { foreach (var prod in group) {
@{Html.RenderAction("ShoppingCartProduct", "ShoppingCart", new { id = group.First().ID });}

} } @if (Model.Prod.HasRange && Model.Prod.WeightFrom.HasValue && Model.Prod.WeightTo.HasValue) {
Price: $@Model.Prod.Price.Value.ToString("0.00")
} Is it possible that someone can guide me how to get that calculation so my output is: product 1 qty 2 price 10 subtotal 20 (qty * unit price) product 2 qty 1 price 20 subtotal 20 (qty * unit price) Many thanks.
